Title: DevOps Engineer
Full Job Description:
Job Summary
As a DevOps Engineer in the ML Platform team, you will contribute to the creation and maintenance of our machine learning infrastructure. This is a heavily Infra/SRE based role, embedded in an ML Platform team. You will be supporting us in maintaining, upgrading and improving our infrastructure and providing support.
The Day-to-Day Activities:
You will utilize GitOps to ensure the reproducibility of the system's cloud infrastructure on different Kubernetes clusters.
Develop observability solutions for Machine Learning pipelines: You will be responsible for developing and integrating monitoring and alerting within Grab’s monitoring stack powered by Datadog, Prometheus, and Grafana.
You will also contribute to the creation of runbooks and DevOps guides.
Deliver high-quality AI infrastructure solutions: You will work with the Machine Leaning Platform team to design and develop the infrastructure to support distributed data processing and model training.
The Must-Haves:
Understand terraform and popular modules like EKS.
Able to understand complex code bases and analyze dependencies.
Understanding of Kubernetes and experience in managing large clusters.
Understanding of core AWS cloud concepts like ec2, autoscaling groups, launch templates, subnets, etc.
Understand core components like coredns, autoscaler, csi driver, load balancer controllers, service mesh, etc.
Perform zero down time cluster upgrades for clusters serving critical online traffic and tight SLA batch jobs

Title: Senior Cloud Network Engineer (Hybrid Working)
Full Job Description:
Company Description
About SEEK
At SEEK, we serve a noble purpose: to help people live more productive and fulfilling working lives and to help organisations succeed.
By joining us, you’ll be part of a multinational technology business that is far-reaching with a start-up working culture that focuses on a set of collaborative values and appreciates dynamic cultures. SEEK is a place where potential meets possibility – it’s where your career aspiration and our purpose can make great things happen.
Why join us?
We’re looking for people who thrive in dynamic teams, appreciate progressive industries, and enjoy tackling regular new challenges in a large-scale, modern, and agile environment. As one of Asia Pacific’s largest tech companies, you’ll contribute to multilingual systems, solving high-impact problems to the benefit of millions of people within the region. Expect a great investment in your career development with access to workshops, conferences & courses while you work alongside seasoned experts. Be part of a fast-growing company with a strong culture and clear purpose, innovation and strong investment in responsible AI. SEEK offers you the opportunity to be involved in impactful work and be part of a great team.
Job Description
The Team
This team is responsible to deliver network services that connect everything within SEEK APAC from digital perspective. This includes Internet, WiFi, remote connectivity, internal data networks, data centre and cloud connectivity. Opportunity to work with diversified team within SEEK; Security, Architecture and Platform Engineering.
About The Role
As a Senior Cloud Network Engineer, you will be responsible for building, maintaining and improving high performance enterprise scale network for SEEK. You will play a key role in design, deployment, managing and optimizing of on-premises and cloud network.
Responsibilities
Design, implement and maintain enterprise-scale network and architecture
Design security patterns for cloud, internal and production networks as well as implement network security initiatives
Manage the lifecycle of network routers, switches, firewalls, wireless controllers etc.
Ensure network performance is optimal and appropriate security controls are in place
Network troubleshooting and fault analysis
Configuration and support of networking between on premise and Azure/AWS cloud
Engage with both internal & wider development teams to deliver solutions
Provide technical mentorship across a wide range of teams and cultures
Keep abreast of new tools and practices and recommend their suitability to ensure the organisation uses the best available technology to improve efficiency.
Ensure SLAs are met for all IT systems and services
Identify areas of risk and proactively seek solutions to mitigate impacts to service and availability.
Evaluate processes to improve productivity and efficiency
Build and maintain relationships with key partners and vendors
Be able to work on-call as rostered or after hours
Qualifications
Essential Skills and Experience
Proven network experience working in cloud and on-prem environment, including design, deploy, support and documentation
In-depth knowledge of on-prem networking environment (VXLAN, BGP-EVPN, Multicast, L3VPN and etc)
Solid experience in AWS/Azure networks (NATGW, IGW, VGW, TGW, CloudWAN, VPC peering and etc)
Knowledge in inter-connectivity between cloud and/or on-prem network best practises (Network Manager, VPC sharing, VPC Lattice, Private Link, Transit VPC and etc)
Automation and IaC skills (Ansible, Python, Terraform, Cloud Formation etc)
Network Security skills (Firewall, NAC, etc)
Strong and analytical problem-solving skills
Excellent communications skills, both written and verbal
Capable of working independently and in a collaborative team environment to tackle problem
Ability to lead and mentor peers by providing guidance and support
Relevant vendor certifications will be highly regarded (CCIE, AWS, PNCSE, etc)
Key Vendor Technologies Used
Routing & Switching: Arista, Cisco
SDWAN: Viptela, VeloCloud, Prisma Access
Firewall: PaloAlto NGFW, Virtual and Prisma
Network Access Control: Cisco ISE, Aruba ClearPass
Network Management/Monitoring/Performance: Splunk, Arista CloudVision, Plixer, DataDog
Network automation: Ansible, Python, Terrafom, Cloud Formation
Cloud Network: AWS, Azure
Additional Information
Perks and benefits
At SEEK we offer:
Support of flexible working, including a mix of office and work from home days depending on your role.
The opportunity to work from anywhere for up to 4 weeks per financial year
Casual dress – every day
At SEEK, we are passionate about fostering a culture of inclusion and wellbeing that embraces and values the diversity of our people. We are a purpose driven business that works with heart.
We know teams with diverse ideas, experiences and perspectives are more creative and are critical to ensuring effective delivery and innovating to enable our future success. As such, we welcome applications from people with diverse backgrounds and life experiences, especially as they relate to gender, sexual identity, culture, faith, disability and life stages. If you have the skills, curiosity and an adaptable mindset but don't meet every responsibility or qualification listed in this advertisement, please still get in touch with us.
Should you require any specific support or adjustments throughout the recruitment process and beyond, please advise us and we will be happy to assist.
For this role, only those with eligible right to work will be considered.
SEEK kindly requests no unsolicited resumes or approaches from recruitment agencies and will not be responsible for any associated fees.

1. Responsible for the development and implementation of overall testing plans to ensure the quality and user experience of the product (short video + e-commerce mobile app).
2. Design and execute test cases, including functional testing, performance testing, security testing, compatibility testing, etc., to ensure test coverage and quality.
3. Track and manage the testing progress, ensuring that the testing plan is synchronized with the product development plan, and timely discover issues and promote problem resolution.
4. Collaborate closely with development team, product team, and UI/UX team to ensure smooth integration of testing with product design and development processes.
5. Continuously optimize the testing process, introduce new testing tools and technologies to improve testing efficiency and accuracy.
6. Write and review test reports, analyze and summarize test results, and provide improvement suggestions.
Requirements:
1. Bachelor's degree or above in computer science, software engineering, or related fields, preferably with 3+ years of work experience as Test Specialist or similar role.
2. Proficient in software testing theories, methods, and technologies, with a deep understanding of the short video and e-commerce industry would be an added advantage.
3. Experience in testing native/web applications on iOS/Android/TV or other common platforms
4. Solid understanding and demonstrable experience of SDLC and QALC, knowledge of QA concepts and methodologies.
5. Strong logical thinking ability, problem analysis, and problem-solving skills, with enthusiasm for testing work.
6. Proficient in both English and Mandarin skills in listening, speaking, reading, and writing, able to read and understand technical documents in both English and Chinese and communicate effectively with foreign colleagues.
7. Good communication skills and teamwork spirit, able to collaborate effectively with development, product, and other teams to advance project progress together.
8. Ability to adapt to a fast-changing work environment.
9. Experience leading projects that involve cross-team collaboration
10. Experience leading or mentoring Test Analysts as technical lead
Preferred Qualification:
Experience testing application/service for short videos.
Experience testing large-scale and critical application/service.
Proficient in at least one mainstream automation testing tool, such as Appium, Robot Framework, or similar frameworks and capable of writing automation test scripts
About Centific
Centific is a frontier AI data foundry that curates diverse, high-quality data, using our purpose-built technology platforms to empower the Magnificent Seven and our enterprise clients with safe, scalable AI deployment. Our team includes more than 150 PhDs and data scientists, along with more than 4,000 AI practitioners and engineers. We harness the power of an integrated solution ecosystem—comprising industry-leading partnerships and 1.8 million vertical domain experts in more than 230 markets—to create contextual, multilingual, pre-trained datasets; fine-tuned, industry-specific LLMs; and RAG pipelines supported by vector databases. Our zero-distance innovation™ solutions for GenAI can reduce GenAI costs by up to 80% and bring solutions to market 50% faster.
Our mission is to bridge the gap between AI creators and industry leaders by bringing best practices in GenAI to unicorn innovators and enterprise customers. We aim to help these organizations unlock significant business value by deploying GenAI at scale, helping to ensure they stay at the forefront of technological advancement and maintain a competitive edge in their respective markets.
Your Authentic Self at Centific
Centific is committed to creating a diverse environment and is proud to be an equal opportunity employer. All qualified applicants will receive consideration for employment without regard to race, color, religion, gender, gender identity or expression, sexual orientation, national origin, genetics, pregnancy, disability, age, veteran status, or other characteristics. Centific is also committed to compliance with all fair employment practices regarding citizenship and immigration status.

Title: Senior Machine Learning Engineer (Game)
Full Job Description:
PLAY, GROW and WIN
To be a part of Virtuos means to be a creator.
At Virtuos, we harness the latest technologies to make games better and more immersive than ever before. That is why we pride ourselves in constantly pushing the boundaries of possibility since our founding in 2004.
Virtuosi is a team of experts – people who have come together to share their mutual passion for making and playing games. People with the same enthusiasm for exploring new ideas and the constant drive to excel in their field. People who believe in earning success through dedication.
At Virtuos, we are at the forefront of gaming, creating exciting new experiences daily. Join us to Play, Grow and Win – together.
ABOUT THE POSITION
We are seeking an innovative Machine Learning Engineer with a passion for building AI assistants and automation tools for our Game ML team. In this role, you will focus on developing and enhancing AI-driven products that assist game developers by leveraging state-of-the-art machine learning techniques and technologies, including Agentic AI, Large Language Models (LLMs), and Small Language Models (SLMs).
Design, develop, and implement machine learning models with a focus on large language models (LLMs), small language models (SLMs), agentic AI agents, and multi-modal models for various tasks and applications.
Collaborate with stakeholders, software engineers, and product teams to define problems, develop solutions, build proofs of concept, conduct experiments, and deploy solutions using modern tools and best practices.
Integrate AI-based solutions into various tech stacks and game engines, such as Maya, Blender, Houdini, Unreal Engine, and Unity.
Develop and maintain our in-house Machine-Learning-as-a-Service (MLaaS) platform.
Stay up to date with the latest advancements in AI/ML, particularly in LLMs, Agentic AI, and Natural Language Processing (NLP).
Bachelor’s or Master’s degree in Computer Science, Machine Learning, or a related field.
5+ years of hands-on experience in Statistical Machine Learning and Deep Learning, with a focus on Natural Language Processing (NLP), Language Models, and Reinforcement Learning.
2+ years of game development experience, working independently or with indie, AA, or AAA studios.
Proficiency in deep learning frameworks (e.g., PyTorch, TensorFlow) and data processing tools (e.g., PySpark, BigQuery).
Experience with game development tools for Digital Content Creation (DCC) and game engines, including Blender, Houdini, Maya, Unreal Engine, and Unity.
Experience deploying ML models via REST APIs.
Experience with NLP techniques, such as sentiment analysis, topic clustering, and question-answering for dataset validation.
Experience with Exploratory Data Analysis (EDA) and Data Visualization
Experience with Docker and Virtual Machines on Windows and Linux platforms.
Experience with LLM frameworks, including LangChain, LangGraph, and DeepEval.
Familiarity with Docker and Virtual Machines on Windows and Linux platforms
Familiarity with common databases such as Postgres and MongoDB
Familiarity with Cloud Services such as AWS, GCP or Azure and their Machine Learning and Machine Learning Operations (MLOps) for both managed and unmanaged services.
Strong problem-solving skills and the ability to work independently and collaboratively in a fast-paced environment.
Preferred Qualifications:
Experience in building game development tools, plugins or modding games
Strong expertise in prompt engineering and chain-of-thought with the ability to measure and validate the effectiveness of different prompting techniques using scientific and data-driven methods.
Experience optimizing test-time/inference-time compute to enhance LLM/SLM outputs.
Knowledge of prompt security techniques, including rail guards, prompt injection defense, and red teaming.
Familiarity with recent advancements in Generative AI, including image generation, 3D asset generation, animation, sound & music generation, and voice cloning.

Title: Associate, Tech & Data Young Talent
Full Job Description:
WHY JOIN US?
We practice a vibrant & energetic office culture.
We provide opportunities for career advancement within the company.
Good performance is always rewarded accordingly.
“It's our people that make Astro Malaysia’s leading entertainment company. We are an inclusive employer, to enable everyone at Astro to be their best. We embrace differences – we celebrate it, we support it, and we thrive on it for the benefit of our employees, our products/services and our community. We also understand and appreciate that diversity is a driver of creativity and innovation, which will make our business more competitive, compelling and profitable.”
JOB RESPONSIBILITIES:
Be part of the team that enable our customers with entertainment that they truly deserve. Together we craft bold and meaningful entertainment that bridges cultures, celebrates shared passions and sparks connections that go beyond screens.
You’ll be joining our
Astro Young Talent Programme (AYTP) under the Tech & Data stream
. AYTP is an 18-months stream-based rotation programme that enable you to contribute to Astro’s vision of reinventing entertainment by bringing better content & products while deepening our relationship with customers. This stream is for
Tech geeks or analytical thinker that are excited to dive into our rich data source or work on the next generation devices, platforms and software solutions that enable us reinventing our customer’s entertainment experience
​.
REQUIREMENTS:
What you will be doing?
You will be placed in multiple rotations spanning across Astro’s key areas of business, predominantly within Technology, Data, ​Software Engineering​ and Products function in which we will align with your career aspiration
You will be given responsibility to drive impactful tasks and projects with opportunity to collaborate across Astro
Goals and KPIs will be curated in each of your rotation depending on the learning plan and tasks that you have been assigned to. These KPIs may be adjusted and amended from time to time depending on the needs and align with the Company’s imperatives.
You will learn about the function of the key division and understand how functions and workflows are connected in a media and entertainment business like Astro
Apart from your day-to-day work, you will have the opportunity to involve in internal events where you internalise our core values of being Creative, Inclusive and Accountable
Who you are?
Fresh graduates in following disciplines or graduates with less than one year working experience on full time basis
Possess a degree (Bachelors/ Masters) in Computer Science/Computer/Engineering/Business IT/ IT/ Statistics or any relevant fields ​
Second Class Upper (CGPA 3.2) and above, or its equivalent​
Foundational level of programming skills in any language such as Python, JavaScript, SQL, Artificial Intelligence (AI) or knowledge of cloud, infrastructure, microservices and basic knowledge of data structures/types, algorithms, and control logic
Good understanding in solution design and problem solving Agile, quick in adapting to changes and having fun working under pressure
Being driven by progress, passionate to drive new initiatives and genuinely collaborating with others to make it happen.
Looking for every opportunity to influence people around you and change our culture through them.
Enjoy writing in everyday language and finding ways of making complex concepts simple
A mindset that embraces curiosity and learning of all kinds and is open to being wrong and failing in the pursuit of learning.
We’re evidence based, not opinion based. So, you’ll be doing lots of quantitative and qualitative research that helps shape what we know about the customers or stakeholder groups.
Demonstrate a natural inclination toward understanding and prioritizing audience needs
Show early potential in project or task management, especially those who have taken on leadership roles in academic, extracurricular, or volunteer settings.

Title: Data Center System Ops Manager (Linux/ Kubernetes/ Johor Bahru) - VH
Full Job Description:
Benefits Summary
This is a full-time permanent role
Medical Leave, Medical Claim, Insurance Coverage, Annual Leaves, Variable Bonuses, Annual Salary Increment Scheme, Nice and Dynamic Work Environment etc.
Basic Salary: RM12,000 – RM18,000 (Commensurate with experience) + Variable Bonuses
Work location: Kulai, Johor Bahru
Working hours: Monday-Friday, 9am-6pm
Our Client
The company is the digital infrastructure arm of an energy company, which is headquartered in Malaysia and listed on Bursa Malaysia. They are supported by a diverse network of experts with both global and local expertise, they build data centres designed to optimise energy efficiency, scalability and reliability. To enable the sustainable growth of today’s data-driven world, they have a goal to power their data centres across the South East Asia region with 100% clean and renewable energy.
They are seeking a
Data Center System Operations Manager
to lead and oversee the operations of their cutting-edge GPU data centers. This role is critical to the company to ensure the seamless functionality, scalability, and performance of their infrastructure that supports high demand AI workloads.
Key Responsibilities
Lead a team of system operation engineers to ensure smooth and reliable data center operations
Mentor, train, and manage the performance of team members to meet organizational goals
Manage daily operations of GPU clusters, ensuring system health, uptime, and performance
Develop and enforce standard operating procedures (SOPs) for data center operations and incident management
Ensure timely resolution of system issues and maintain SLA compliance
Optimize workflows, including hardware provisioning, monitoring, and scaling GPU resources
Collaborate with cross-functional teams, including network engineers, software developers, and project managers, to support AI workload requirements
Manage the deployment, configuration, and optimization of GPU servers, network devices, and supporting infrastructure (e.g. CPU servers and storage)
Work closely with cross-functional teams, including network engineers, system administrators, and developers, to support AI workloads
Establish clear operational objectives, KPIs, and ensure accountability across the team
Generate detailed operational reports, including incident analysis and recommendations for improvement
Requirements
Bachelor’s degree in Computer Science, Information Technology, Electrical Engineering, or a related field. Equivalent experience will be considered. Master’s degree is preferred
5+ years of experience
in data center operations or system administration, with at least
2 years
in a managerial role
Exceptional experience in data center operations, system administration, or a similar role
Familiarity with monitoring and automation tools
Strong experience with storage systems
(e.g., NVMe, SAN, NAS)
, networking concepts, and protocols
(e.g., TCP/IP, RDMA)
will be advantageous
Knowledgeable in operating ticketing system and troubleshooting process in
CPU/GPU cluster
Strong knowledge of
GPU hardware (e.g., NVIDIA GPUs)
, server architecture, and storage solutions
Familiarity with networking concepts, including

Title: Quality Assurance Engineer (IT)
Full Job Description:
Role Overview
Senior
As a Quality Assurance Engineer, you will play a critical role in ensuring the quality and reliability of our products. You will lead testing initiatives, implement automated testing strategies, and mentor junior team members, contributing directly to Elevatek's long-term business goals. This position offers the opportunity for professional growth and skill-building in automation technologies, allowing you to make a significant impact on our quality assurance processes.
Junior/Intermediate
As a Quality Assurance Engineer, you will be responsible for preparing and executing test plans and test cases, identifying defects, and supporting the QA team in delivering high-quality software. You will work closely with developers, senior QA engineers, and product teams to validate functionality, usability, and performance across various platforms. This role offers an excellent opportunity to enhance your expertise in both manual and automated testing while contributing to process improvements and upholding Elevatek’s quality standards.
About Us
We strive to become a competitive force in the testing services industry, we seek passionate QA professionals who are committed to excellence, innovation, and automation. Join us in our mission to enhance user experiences through rigorous quality assurance practices while fostering a collaborative and growth-oriented environment. Company Website: https://www.synatix.biz/  |  Linkedin: https://www.linkedin.com/company/synatixbiz
Why Join Us?
Growth Opportunities: We prioritize your professional development and QA certifications with training for enhancing manual and automation skills and advancing your career path.
Collaborative Culture: Be part of an innovative and supportive team environment where your contributions are valued, and teamwork is encouraged.
Impactful Work: Play a vital role in elevating the quality of our products, directly impacting user satisfaction and business success.
Flexible Working Arrangements: We support work-life balance through a hybrid working model giving you flexibility and the opportunity to collaborate closely with colleagues.
Comprehensive Benefits: Enjoy a competitive salary, performance-based annual bonuses, and a robust benefits package that includes Annual Leave, Medical Leave, Medical Reimbursements, Insurance Coverage, Wellness Reimbursements, Parking Subsidy, Monthly Team Lunch Reimbursement, Company Treats (e.g., Lunch/Tea Time), Annual Dinner & Monthly Staff Engagement Activities.
Key Responsibilities
Senior
Test Automation: Design, implement, and maintain automated test frameworks using tools such as Testim, Postman, JMeter, Selenium and others to optimize testing efficiency and coverage.
Testing Strategy Development: Collaborate with cross-functional teams to develop comprehensive test plans that address functional, performance, and usability aspects of our platforms (desktop, mobile, iOS, Android, API).
Testing Execution and Reporting: Execute manual and automated tests, track and manage defects using a bug-tracking system, and produce detailed test reports adhering to QA standards.
Mentorship and Team Collaboration: Mentor junior QA team members, fostering a culture of continuous learning and improvement in QA practices.
Root Cause Analysis: Conduct thorough analyses of defects to identify root causes and collaborate with development team to solve the issue.
Participate in Design Reviews: Engage in software design reviews to provide input on quality and testability of new features, ensuring alignment with user expectations.
Continuous Improvement: Proactively identify areas for improvement in the testing process, recommending new tools, techniques, and strategies to enhance overall quality."
Junior/Intermediate
Test Execution & Defect Management: Execute manual test cases, report defects, and track them using a bug-tracking system to ensure high-quality software delivery.
Test Plan & Case Preparation: Create and maintain test plans and test cases based on functional and business requirements.
Collaboration & Support: Work closely with developers, senior QA engineers, and product teams to validate software functionality, usability, and performance across platforms (desktop, mobile, iOS, Android, API).
Basic Automation Testing: Gain hands-on experience with automation tools like Testim, Postman, JMeter, and Selenium under guidance, contributing to automated test execution.
Root Cause Analysis: Analyze defects and reproduce issues to help identify root causes in collaboration with senior QA, QA lead and development teams.
Participate in Design Reviews: Join requirement and design review discussions to gain insight into testing strategies and improve test coverage.
Process Improvement & Learning: Continuously develop QA skills, stay updated on best practices, and contribute to refining testing processes within the team.
Requirements
Senior
Must-Have Skills
A minimum of 5 years of experience in software quality assurance, with minimum 3 years hands on experience in automation testing.
Proficiency in automated testing frameworks (e.g., Selenium, JMeter).
Have advanced skills in Postman or experience in creating custom test scripts.
Strong understanding of QA methodologies and testing processes.
Actively involves in Agile ceremonies such as sprint planning, grooming, daily standup, demo and retrospective).
Experience with defect management and test case management tools (e.g., JIRA, TestRail).
Excellent analytical and problem-solving skills.
Strong communication (oral and written) and interpersonal skills.
Nice-to-Have Skills
Familiarity with continuous integration/continuous deployment (CI/CD) pipelines.
Knowledge of programming languages such as C# and Java.
ISTQB or equivalent certification in software testing.
PSM / CSM or equivalent certification in software testing.
Familiar with BDD / TDD framework.
Experience with cloud environment like AWS and Azure.
Junior/Intermediate
Must-Have Skills:
A minimum of 2-3 years of experience in software quality assurance, with a strong foundation in manual testing.
Basic knowledge of automation testing and willingness to learn frameworks such as Testim (Other UI automation tool), JMeter, and Postman)
Understanding of QA methodologies, testing processes, and defect lifecycle.
Hands-on experience with test case management and defect tracking tools (e.g., JIRA, TestRail).
Familiarity with Agile methodologies and participation in Agile ceremonies (e.g., sprint planning, grooming, daily standups).
Strong analytical and problem-solving skills to identify, track, and troubleshoot defects.
Good communication and teamwork skills, with the ability to work collaboratively with developers and senior QA engineers.
Nice-to-Have Skills:
Basic experience or exposure to automation scripting in automation tool (Testim, Postman, other UI automation tool).
Knowledge of programming languages such as JavaScript and C# for test automation.
ISTQB Foundation Level certification or equivalent software testing certification.
PSM / CSM or equivalent certification in software testing.
Exposure to AI-driven test tools (e.g., Testim, Applitools).
Understanding of BDD/TDD frameworks.
Familiarity with CI/CD pipelines and DevOps practices.

Title: Lead Data Scientist, Deliveries & ACE
Full Job Description:
Get to know the Team
In the ACE (Deliveries, Mart, Omnicommerce) Data Science team you are at the core and center of Grab’s delivery and omnicommerce business. We build and deploy AI/ML models to empower seamless user experiences across Grab’s food ecosystem, from meal deliveries to restaurant reservations. Our mission is to enhance user satisfaction, drive growth, and optimize platform efficiency by leveraging data science to solve unique challenges in delivery, demand forecasting, and personalized dining experiences.
Get to know the role
We are looking for Lead data scientists who will own their projects end-to-end, from defining the problem space, proposing scalable DS solutions, implementing DS services and to conducting experiments and model enhancement. You will work closely with cross functional stakeholders including Engineering, analytics, Product etc, independently to deliver advanced data-driven solutions.
The Critical Tasks You Will Perform
Extract Insights: Analyze massive datasets (geospatial, behavioral, transactional) to understand user shopping patterns, improve user experiences for delivery and dine-out/Reserve services.
Identify business opportunity and propose AI solutions to solve user problem and create business impact:
User Experience: Predicting users shopping needs & shopping patterns, shopping preference, cancellation probability and etc. Identify ways to improve our user experience by providing them most personalised recommendations, improving service reliability, etc
Demand Forecasting: Predict meal delivery demand spikes and restaurant reservation trends.
Demand Shaping: optimise visibility to ensure we are shaping demand to meet supply to optimise the network throughput and reduce unfulfilled demand
Demand generation: enable smart targeting of different user segments for demand generation
Build, Iterate and Deploy: Build AI models to enable business. Continuously refine models through A/B testing and production monitoring.
Collaborate Cross-Functionally: Partner with product managers, engineers, analytics, design and operations teams to scale solutions.
Contribute to team’s innovation and IP creation

Title: Product Designer (IT)
Full Job Description:
About us:
Established in 2015, Uhomes.com is one of the leading accommodation booking platforms for global students.
Backed up by prominent investors such as New Oriental group, listed company on NYSE with market cap of $13bn; and Translink capital, a venture capital fund from Silicon Valley and a few more. Since 2015, Uhomes has an international operation with offices located in the London, New York, Boston, Los Angeles, Beijing, Malaysia, Thailand, Taiwan and operations in over 27 countries or regions. We continue to look for expansion into multiple countries as well as to diversify our property portfolios.
We’re looking for a Product Designer to enhance our rental housing platform across web and mobile apps. You’ll create user-friendly designs, collaborate with cross-functional teams, and ensure the platform is culturally relevant for international markets (U.S., Japan, Korea, Vietnam, Thailand). Additionally, you'll contribute to integrating AI-driven features to improve user experience. You should possess strong background and experience in User Experience Design (UED) and UI/UX design skills. Experience in localization and familiarity with tools like Figma or Sketch are required.
This is a full-time, on-site role for a Product Designer located at KL Eco City, Kuala Lumpur, Malaysia.
Description
Collaborate in designing and adapting international versions of our rental housing platform, ensuring a seamless and culturally relevant experience for English, Japanese, Korean, Vietnamese, and Thai-speaking users
Contribute to the localization of the platform for the U.S. market, focusing on optimizing user interface, content, and functionalities across multiple platforms (PC/H5, mobile apps)
Work with headquarter and local teams to ensure that features and language are appropriate for regional preferences, legal requirements and cultural nuances
Partner with UX/ UI designers, product managers and engineers to enhance the design and functionality of our AI Agent project, focusing on AI-driven user experience improvements
Contribute to the design process by integrating user feedback, market research, and data analytics to drive AI features that enhance usability and engagement.
Help define the product roadmap by contributing insights on user needs and AI capabilities that can improve overall experience.
Provide ongoing suggestions for product improvements based on user behavior data, market trends, and competitive analysis.
Collaborate in identifying pain points in the user journey and suggest AI-driven or design-focused solutions for enhancement.
Ensure consistent updates to both the global and regional platforms, keeping user needs and preferences at the forefront.
Qualifications
Bachelor's degree or higher is required; candidates with a background in UX or Computer Science are preferred
Strong background and experience in
User Experience Design (UED) and UI/UX design skills
Proficiency in at least one prototyping tool, such as Figma, Sketch, or Axure, is required
Strong analytical skills with the ability to assess the impact of new features through data analysis.
Open to candidates with no prior experience, as well as those with up to 3 years of relevant experience.
Possess full working rights for Malaysia
Why Join Us?
Opportunity to lead and optimize a globally expanding team
Professional development and training opportunities, including overseas training programs
Competitive salary and career growth opportunities
Dynamic and collaborative work environment
The chance to make a meaningful impact in the student accommodation industry
Great learning and developing opportunity
Next to LRT (Abdullah Hukum station)
Flexible working hours

Title: Senior Machine Learning Engineer
Full Job Description:
Responsibilities:
Develops scripts and software that integrate ML models into larger systems
Selects the most appropriate ML libraries and frameworks based on specific use cases
Optimizes the training process for ML models, ensuring efficiency and scalability
Implements robust APIs for model inference, making models available for real-time or batch predictions
Designs data structures that optimize model performance and data processing speed
Manages compute resources effectively to ensure models train and run efficiently
Sets up logging systems and generates key metrics to monitor model and system perfor-mance
Conducts hyperparameter tuning and evaluates different models to find the best fit for the task
Monitors for and mitigates model degradation and drift in production environments
Deploys models in a way that ensures reliability and scalability in production
Creates CI/CD pipelines to automate the model lifecycle, from development to production up-dates
Requirements:
Degree in Computer Science, Engineering, AI/ML, or a related field (or equivalent experience)
Strong object oriented software development skills, with a focus on machine learning applica-tions
Mastery of ML-relevant libraries and frameworks (e.g., TensorFlow, PyTorch, Scikit-learn)
Expertise in selecting the right tools and frameworks based on project needs
Knowledge of building and optimizing ML pipelines, including parallelization techniques
Experience in deploying models through APIs for inference and real-time usage
Familiarity with data structures and compute architectures that enhance model performance
Ability to implement logging systems and generate performance metrics
Knowledge of hyperparameter tuning, model selection, and training processes
Experience with monitoring model degradation and drift in production
Expertise in creating and managing CI/CD pipelines for ML model deployment
Familiarity with cloud platforms (e.g., AWS, GCP) and distributed computing environments
Excellent communication and teamwork skills to collaborate across technical and business teams
Primary Skills:
Core Libraries: Python 3.11+, pandas, NumPy, scikit-learn
Deep Learning: TensorFlow, Keras, PyTorch
Natural Language Processing: (Azure) OpenAI, Prompt Engineering, transformers, Langchain
Development & Deployment: Git, Docker
Data Visualization & Application: Streamlit, Matplotlib
Azure: Azure Cognitive Services, Azure Databricks
Secondary Skills:
Azure Databases & Data Services: Azure Cosmos DB, Azure Data Factory
Life at Arvato Systems Malaysia:
Are you ready to join a team that continuously nurtures creativity, champions entrepreneurship, and values every individual's contribution? Our agile and collaborative culture cultivates empowerment through ownership, trust, and respect. Within this environment, we innovate through value creation and delving into technology, shaping boundless possibilities in our ecosystem.
What's in it for YOU:
Innovate Fearlessly: We fearlessly challenge the status quo. Innovation runs deep within our core, and we're continually seeking groundbreaking solutions. Your ideas matter, and we offer the platform for them to flourish.
Invest in Growth: We prioritize your professional development with diverse learning, mentorship, and resources nurturing your growth through ample training opportunities.
Work-Life Harmony: At our company, we prioritize work-life harmony, championing flexibility, and support to ensure your welfare. Your mental wellness is our priority. We're committed to fostering a healthy balance between work and personal life for a happier, healthier you.
Attractive Benefits: Our flexible benefits package is designed to cater to your individual needs, complemented by exclusive perks such as Birthday Leave, Family Care Leave, and sponsored meals.
Collaboration over Competition: Teamwork isn't just an idea here - it's our way of life.
Thriving on Diversity: Embracing unique viewpoints and backgrounds, we ensure Equity and Inclusivity are at the heart of our success.
Celebrate Success: From big wins to small victories, every achievement deserves its moment in the spotlight. From project milestones to personal goals and team triumphs, we're all about raising the flag high for success!
Wellness & Well-being are Fundamental: We view wellness as more than personal health - it's the foundation of our caring, connected community. This emphasis on well-being drives our culture of rapid exploration and learning, propelling us forward together.
Uniting through Fun: From annual company trips to quarterly team outings, we build trust and camaraderie by engaging in enjoyable activities together.
Giving Back: Rooted in our values, we actively engage in initiatives supporting meaningful causes that benefit society. Our commitment to Corporate Responsibility is the cornerstone of our journey toward excellence.
Join Arvato Systems Malaysia for a transformative career journey. Our commitment to fair opportunities means we value skills and performance above all else - everyone is welcome to build a brighter future together.
About us
Global IT specialist Arvato Systems supports major companies through Digital Transformation. About 3,300 staff in over 25 locations epitomize in-depth technology expertise, industry knowledge, and focus on customer requirements. Working as a team, we develop innovative IT solutions, transition our clients into the Cloud, integrate digital processes, and take on IT systems operation and support.

Title: Senior QA Analyst
Full Job Description:
We are seeking a highly skilled
Senior QA Analyst
with hands-on experience in automation testing to join our dynamic team. This role will play a critical part in ensuring the quality and performance of our software products, driving automation strategies, and introducing intelligent testing practices to elevate our QA processes.
Key Responsibilities:
Design, develop, and execute advanced automated test scripts using AI-based tools and frameworks.
Evaluate and implement AI solutions to improve test efficiency, accuracy, and coverage.
Collaborate closely with developers, product managers to understand business requirements and translate them into effective test strategies.
Conduct functional, regression, performance, and integration testing across multiple platforms.
Identify, document, and track defects; work with development teams to ensure timely resolution.
Continuously improve test automation frameworks and recommend best practices for integrating AI into QA workflows.
Mentor and guide junior QA analysts on automation and AI testing techniques.
Analyze test results, generate detailed reports, and present findings to stakeholders.
Stay updated with industry trends, tools, and technologies in AI testing and automation.
Qualifications:
Bachelor’s degree in Computer Science, Information Technology, Engineering, or a related field.
4–6 years of experience in software quality assurance, with at least 2 years in a senior or lead role.
Proven experience in designing and implementing test automation frameworks.
Hands-on experience with AI-based testing tools and technologies (e.g., Testim, Applitools, Mabl, Functionize, or similar).
Familiarity with CI/CD pipelines and tools like Jenkins, GitLab, or Azure DevOps.
Solid understanding of software development lifecycle (SDLC) and Agile methodologies.
Excellent analytical, problem-solving, and communication skills.

Title: Senior Manager - DAT Process Assurance, IT Audit (PwC Acceleration Center Kuala
Full Job Description:
Line of Service
Assurance
Industry/Sector
Specialism
Management Level
Senior Manager
Job Description & Summary
At PwC, our people in audit and assurance focus on providing independent and objective assessments of financial statements, internal controls, and other assurable information enhancing the credibility and reliability of this information with a variety of stakeholders. They evaluate compliance with regulations including assessing governance and risk management processes and related controls.
In digital assurance at PwC, you will focus on providing assurance services over clients' digital environment, including processes and controls, cyber security measures, data and AI systems, and their associated governance, to help organisations and their stakeholders build trust in their technology while complying with relevant regulations.
Growing as a strategic advisor, you leverage your influence, expertise, and network to deliver quality results. You motivate and coach others, coming together to solve complex problems. As you increase in autonomy, you apply sound judgment, recognising when to take action and when to escalate. You are expected to solve through complexity, ask thoughtful questions, and clearly communicate how things fit together. Your ability to develop and sustain high performing, diverse, and inclusive teams, and your commitment to excellence, contributes to the success of our Firm.
Examples of the skills, knowledge, and experiences you need to lead and deliver value at this level include but are not limited to:
Craft and convey clear, impactful and engaging messages that tell a holistic story.
Apply systems thinking to identify underlying problems and/or opportunities.
Validate outcomes with clients, share alternative perspectives, and act on client feedback.
Direct the team through complexity, demonstrating composure through ambiguous, challenging and uncertain situations.
Deepen and evolve your expertise with a focus on staying relevant.
Initiate open and honest coaching conversations at all levels.
Make difficult decisions and take action to resolve issues hindering team effectiveness.
Model and reinforce professional and technical standards (e.g. refer to specific PwC tax and audit guidance), the Firm's code of conduct, and independence requirements.
Minimum Degree Required:
Chartered Accountant or Bachelors Degree
Required Fields of Study:
Accounting, Finance, Management Information Systems, Computer Science, Economics, Business Administration/Management, Engineering, Mathematics, Statistics
,
and/or other relevant degree.
Credential Required:
Chartered Accountant, CISA or US CPA
Minimum Years of Experience:
10 years of relevant experience (auditing and IT controls auditing, consulting and/or implementing IT solutions)
Oral and written proficiency in English required.
Preferred Knowledge/Skills:
Demonstrates intimate abilities and/or a proven record of success in providing services related to controls around the financial reporting, compliance and operational processes, including business process and IT management controls, which includes a proven record of success with managing the following:
Managing financial reporting and information technology risks, processes and controls;
Managing current and emerging technologies which may include Cloud-computing, Oracle, SAP, Oracle Database, web development tools, virtualization, UNIX, Linux, and security technologies;
Managing risks, processes and internal controls related to financial reporting or non-financial reporting, both manual and IT;
Managing COSO Framework, CoBIT, ITIL and/or other leading business and IT control frameworks;
Managing relevant subject matter specialization to support the development of thought leadership; and,
Managing key internal operational processes of a professional services firm, e.g., engagement economics, billing and collection, performance appraisals, time reporting, personal independence and compliance requirements.
Leading IT related controls assurance or controls readiness projects associated with external audits, internal audits or service organization controls reports, e.g., SOC 1/SOC 2;
Identifying the need to adapt work programs and practices to create tailored solutions for clients;
Identifying key risks and controls, recommending improved controls, performing controls readiness projects and identifying and assessing configuration of controls in financial reporting related business processes as well as in IT infrastructures, security, change management, operations and program development;
Leading the adaption a work program and practice aid to create tailored solutions for our clients; and,
Identifying and addressing client needs, as well as beginning to develop strong client relationships, emphasizing the identification, creation and leveraging of relationships to identify additional service opportunities.
Demonstrates intimate abilities and/or a proven record of success in the following areas:
Creating a positive and motivating environment;
Monitoring workloads of the team while meeting client expectations;
Respecting the work-life quality of team members;
Providing candid, meaningful feedback in a timely manner; and,
Keeping leadership informed of progress.

Title: Software Engineer (C/C++)
Full Job Description:
Provide software support to customers, develop and test machine software ensuring stability and compliance. Collaborate with engineering teams, support installations, and deliver training.
Client Details
This is a U.S.-based global manufacturer that designs, develops, and supplies semiconductor test and inspection handlers, thermal subsystems, test contactors, and MEMS test modules. It plays a key role in supporting the semiconductor industry, particularly in areas like automotive, consumer electronics, industrial, and mobility markets.
Description
Provide software support to customers and evaluate modification requests for new or retrofit machines.
Develop machine software and ensure it meets customer specifications and stability requirements.
Test and qualify software to ensure high quality before machine shipment.
Collaborate with hardware and engineering teams to assess system integration and performance needs.
Attend project kick-off meetings and follow up on preventive actions from past quality issues.
Support onsite installation and qualification until machine buyoff is completed.
Conduct training and knowledge sharing within the software team.
Handle other ad-hoc tasks related to core responsibilities.
Profile
Bachelor's degree in Engineering (Electrical/Electronic/Computer/Software/Mechatronics/Robotics) or Computer Science.
Skilled in PLC, C, and C++ programming with at least 4 years in semiconductor or machine automation.
Able to manage multiple projects under pressure, including extra hours, weekends, and travel if required.
Strong communication, adaptability, and a continuous improvement mindset.
Ethical, patient, creative, and proactive with sharp problem-solving skills and a high sense of urgency.
Job Offer
Opportunity to work with cutting-edge manufacturing and automation technologies.
Gain experience in a global company known for innovation and industry leadership.
Collaborative environment that supports continuous learning and professional growth.
Exposure to diverse projects involving software development, hardware integration, and AI/IoT solutions.
Competitive benefits and the chance to contribute to impactful industrial automation systems.

Title: Android Engineer (APP Development)
Full Job Description:
Responsible in Designing, developing, maintain Android mobile applications. Ensure the performance, reliability, and functionality of the applications on a range of devices and operating systems, and also collaborate with cross-functional teams to define, design, and ship new features.
Key Responsibilities
Project Planning and Execution:
You will be responsible for planning, scheduling, and executing Android projects efficiently, ensuring timely delivery and high-quality outcomes.
Problem-Solving and Decision-Making:
As an Android Engineer, you will tackle complex challenges, make critical decisions regarding architecture and design, and troubleshoot issues to optimize app performance.
Collaboration with Cross-Functional Teams:
Work closely with cross-functional teams including QA testers, product managers, and UX designers to align on project goals, enhance user experiences, and deliver exceptional mobile applications.
Leadership and Mentorship:
Provide technical leadership, mentor junior team members, and contribute to a positive team culture by sharing knowledge and best practices.
Process Improvement and Innovation:
Continuously seek opportunities to innovate, optimize development processes, and implement best practices to drive efficiency and quality in Android app development.
Technical or Customer-Facing Responsibilities:
Engage in technical discussions, collaborate with clients to understand their requirements, and ensure the successful delivery of Android solutions that meet customer expectations.
Required Skills and Qualifications
Technical Skills:
Proficiency in Java, Kotlin, Android SDK, SQLite. Experienced in using “Android Studio” or code editing, debugging, and performance analysis. Familiar with common design patterns and their application in Android development.
Educational Requirements:
Bachelor’s degree in Computer Science, Software Engineering, or related field.
Experience Level:
3+ years of experience in Android development, with a proven track record of delivering successful mobile applications.
Soft Skills:
Strong problem-solving abilities, excellent communication skills, adaptability to changing project requirements, leadership qualities, and a collaborative mindset.
Industry Knowledge:
Understanding of mobile app development best practices, familiarity with UI/UX principles, and knowledge of mobile security considerations.
Preferred Qualifications
Experience in developing apps for diverse industries such as AI development, hand-writing, etc.
Holding advanced certifications like Google Associate Android Developer or AWS Certified Developer.
Familiarity with emerging technologies such as AR/VR, IoT, or blockchain in the mobile app space.
Demonstrated experience in scaling operations, launching apps in global markets, or implementing process improvements.
Participation in industry conferences, presenting at tech events, or contributing to open-source projects.
Additional foreign language proficiency beneficial for collaborating with global stakeholders (Chinese & English.)

Title: Salesforce System Analyst
Full Job Description:
About ADA
ADA is a leading data and artificial intelligence (AI) company that designs and executes integrated digital, analytics, and marketing solutions. We operate in 11 markets in Asia and partner with leading brands to drive their data and digital maturity.
What will you do?
1. Salesforce Administration & System Maintenance
Manage user roles, profiles, permissions, and security settings to maintain system integrity.
Configure and maintain objects, fields, workflows, validation rulers and page layouts
Oversee sandbox management, production deployments, and system updates, ensuring minimal disruption.
Collaborate with Salesforce developers to implement enhancements and integrations.
Conduct regular data audits, de-duplication, and cleanup processes for system accuracy.
Stay ahead of Salesforce releases, proactively implementing relevant new features.
Troubleshoot and resolve technical issues and user requests efficiently.
2. Process Automation & System Optimisation
Design and implement Flows, Process Builder, and automation rules to streamline sales workflows.
Manage integrations between Salesforce and third-party tools (e.g. HubSpot, LinkedIn Sales Navigator)
Continuously assess system performance, recommending enhancements to improve efficiency, automation, and scalability.
3. Reporting & Data Insights
Develop and refine reports and dashboards to track sales performance, pipeline health, and forecasting.
Empower teams with self-service reporting for Business Development, Marketing, and leadership teams.
Enforce data accuracy and governance to ensure consistent, reliable reporting.
4. User Enablement & Adoption
Create and maintain clear documentation on system changes, best practices and workflows
Conduct training sessions, audits, and feedback loops to drive Salesforce adoption.
Act as the go-to Salesforce expert, helping teams maximise value from Salesforce effectively.
What skills and experience you will need?
Bachelor’s degree in Degree in Computer Science, Information Systems, Software Engineering, or equivalent.
Salesforce Certified Administrator is highly preferred.
3-5+ years of experience in Salesforce administration, CRM implementation, or consulting within high-growth SaaS, AI, or digital businesses.
Strong expertise in Salesforce Sales & Service Cloud, with hands-on experience in configuring workflows, Process Builder, Flows, custom objects, fields, page layouts, record types, validation rules, reports and dashboards.
Salesforce Certified Administrator certification required; additional certifications (e.g., Advanced Administrator, Platform App Builder) and proficiency in data visualization tools (e.g., Tableau, Power BI) are a plus.
Familiarity with Apex, REST APIs and SOQL/SOSL, as well as experience with JavaScript, HTML, or Lightning Web Components for UI enhancement is a plus.
Strong understanding of sales processes, methodologies, and best practices.
Excellent communication and stakeholder management skills, with experience working across cross-functional teams.
Strong analytical and problem-solving skills, with the ability to translate business needs into scalable system and process improvements.

Title: Data Scientist (Internal Audit)
Full Job Description:
Are you ready to get ahead in your career?
We want to empower you to turn your ambitions into achievements.
We thrive in inclusiveness, diversity and embrace close collaborations for you to create impact for yourself and others.
Together, we aim to bring the best of technology to help people, businesses and the nation to be ahead in a changing world.
To realise our vision to become Malaysia’s leading converged solutions company, we are looking for a new talent to innovate and grow with us in a culture that values commitment, performance and possibilities.
Why does this job exist and why is it critical?​
This role is to carry out the responsibilities in ensuring that the Internal Assurance’s data science capabilities are effectively implemented and operated, especially in the design, development and operation of the continuous auditing technologies and processes. The role will essentially help IA to innovate in gaining insights on the risks, governance and controls through advancement in audit automation technologies and processes such as data analytics, Artificial Intelligence (AI) and Robotics Process Automation (RPA).
What are you accountable for?
Analyse audit analytics requirements and translate into audit automation solutions using applicable technologies e.g. ETL, data analytics, AI and/or RPA
Develop, test, implement, operate and maintain ETL, data analytics, AI and/or other automation solutions using suitable tools or systems with satisfactory quality, accompanied with adequate level of documentation
Liaise with stakeholders to obtain continuous data from primary or secondary data sources and maintain a suitable database platform for IA’s automation purposes
Design and develop data reporting tools and processes for continuous assurance results, which include data visualization using related data visualization tools
Identify new ideas for process improvements/enhancements and develop, test and implement using related current technologies/methodologies for roll-out
Implement and carry out adequate data governance activities to ensure confidentiality, integrity and availability of stored and processed data by the continuous assurance platform
Provide technical support to the team and/or business counterparts in the areas of technical audit data analysis, automation and related tools/technologies as well as coaching the team on usage of those tools/technologies
Working closely and build relationship with Stakeholders for ensuring effective continuous assurance service deliverables from Internal Assurance Division
Providing consultative advice to Stakeholders by identifying and recommending value-added data analytics insights and approach
What do you need to have for this role?
Bachelor Degree in Mathematics and Statistics, Computer Science, or Engineering
Masters in Data Science / Data Analytics Certifications will be an added advantage
4-6 years of total working experience (At least 3+ years of working experience relevant to the field of data science
Technical expertise in data analytics, data visualization, machine learning and ETL techniques
Strong knowledge of and experience with databases (e.g. Microsoft SQL), programming languages (e.g. Python), SQL scripting, ETL platforms (e.g. MS SSIS), data reporting and visualization tools (e.g. Looker Studio, Power BI etc.)
Proven knowledge utilising common data science toolkits such as Python, R, SQL, etc.
Proficient in data visualization and data storytelling
Strong statistical, analytical, and problem solving skills
Familiarity with cloud platforms and technologies e.g. Google Cloud Platform, Azure, AWS etc.
Passionate in learning new technologies and skills
Desirable
Proven experience in building predictive models
Knowledge and/or proven experience in using RPA tools (e.g. UiPath)
Internal or external auditing experience
What’s next?
Once you’ve applied online, our team will carefully review your application. Due to a high volume of applications, we appreciate your patience to allow for a fair and timely review process.
Should you be shortlisted for the role, we will send you an invitation via email for a digital interview. You can also check on your application status by logging into your candidate account.
Maxis values diverse voices & people. We hire and reward our employees based on capability & performance — regardless of ethnicity, gender, age, education, religion, nationality or physical ability.

Title: IT Technical Trainer (AWS/Azure Cloud)
Full Job Description:
Your New Company -
My client is a premier leader in the technology training industry, recognised for delivering unmatched expertise and innovation in the market.

Conduct training and provide consultancy in the respective area of specialisation.
Organise, set-up and deliver courses to meet the needs of customers and carry out training needs analysis.

Title: Data Scientist - QuantumBlack
Full Job Description:
Driving lasting impact and building long-term capabilities with our clients is not easy work. You are the kind of person who thrives in a high performance/high reward culture - doing hard things, picking yourself up when you stumble, and having the resilience to try another way forward.
In return for your drive, determination, and curiosity, we'll provide the resources, mentorship, and opportunities you need to become a stronger leader faster than you ever thought possible. Your colleagues—at all levels—will invest deeply in your development, just as much as they invest in delivering exceptional results for clients. Every day, you'll receive apprenticeship, coaching, and exposure that will accelerate your growth in ways you won’t find anywhere else.
When you join us, you will have:
Continuous learning:
Our learning and apprenticeship culture, backed by structured programs, is all about helping you grow while creating an environment where feedback is clear, actionable, and focused on your development. The real magic happens when you take the input from others to heart and embrace the fast-paced learning experience, owning your journey.
A voice that matters:
From day one, we value your ideas and contributions. You’ll make a tangible impact by offering innovative ideas and practical solutions. We not only encourage diverse perspectives, but they are critical in driving us toward the best possible outcomes.
Global community:
With colleagues across 65+ countries and over 100 different nationalities, our firm’s diversity fuels creativity and helps us come up with the best solutions for our clients. Plus, you’ll have the opportunity to learn from exceptional colleagues with diverse backgrounds and experiences.
World-class benefits:
On top of a competitive salary (based on your location, experience, and skills), we provide a comprehensive benefits package, which includes medical, dental, mental health, and vision coverage for you, your spouse/partner, and children.
Only at McKinsey you will work on real-world, high-impact projects across a variety of industries. You will have the opportunity to collaborate with QB/Labs teams and build complex and innovative ML systems to accelerate our work in AI and help solve business problems at speed and scale.
You will experience the best environment to grow as a technologist and a leader. You will develop a sought-after perspective connecting technology and business value by working on real-life problems across a variety of industries and technical challenges to serve our clients on their changing needs.
You will be surrounded by inspiring individuals as part of diverse and multidisciplinary teams. You will develop a holistic perspective of AI by partnering with the best design, technical, and business talent in the world as your team members.
While we advocate for using the right tech for the right task, we often leverage the following technologies: Python, PySpark, the PyData stack, SQL, Airflow, Databricks, our own open-source data pipelining framework called Kedro, Dask/RAPIDS, container technologies such as Docker and Kubernetes, cloud solutions such as AWS, GCP, and Azure, and more.
As a Data Scientist, you will:
Partner with our clients, from data owners and users to C-level executives, to understand their needs and build impactful analytics solutions
Contribute to cross-functional problem-solving sessions with your team and deliver presentations to colleagues and client
Translate business problems into analytical problems and develop models aimed at solving our clients and users problems and ensure they are evaluated with the relevant metrics
Write highly optimized code to advance our internal Data Science Toolbox
Add real-world impact to your academic expertise, as you are encouraged to write papers and present at meetings and conferences should you wish
Take part in R&D projects; attend conferences such as NIPS and ICML as well as data science retrospectives where you will have the opportunity to share and learn from your co-workers
Work in one of the most advanced data science teams globally
Work on the frameworks and libraries that our teams of data scientists and data engineers use to progress from data to impact
Guide global companies through data science solutions to transform their businesses and enhance performance across industries including healthcare, automotive, energy and elite sport
You will work with other data scientists, data engineers, machine learning engineers, designers and project managers on interdisciplinary projects, using math, stats and machine learning to derive structure and knowledge from raw data across various industry sectors.
You are highly collaborative individual who is capable of laying aside your own agenda, listening to and learning from colleagues, challenging thoughtfully and prioritizing impact. You search for ways to improve things and work collaboratively with colleagues. You believe in iterative change, experimenting with new approaches, learning and improving to move forward quickly.
Bachelor's, master's or PhD level in a discipline such as: computer science, machine learning, applied statistics, mathematics, engineering or artificial intelligence
2+ years of professional experience in applying machine learning and data mining techniques to real problems with copious amounts of data
Programming experience (focus on machine learning): SQL and Python’s Data Science stack are a must; good knowledge of at least one big data framework (Pyspark, Hive, Hadoop) is a plus; R, SPSS, SAS (nice to have); Software Engineering is a plus
Ability to prototype statistical analysis and modeling algorithms and apply these algorithms for data driven solutions to problems in new domains
Experience deploying technology applied to business problems is a plus
Knowledge in applying machine learning solution to real problems with complex and/or big amounts of data
Knowledge in prompt engineering & GenAI application building (RAG, Agentic systems). Having basic understanding of Engineering standards, QA/Risk Management
Willingness to travel

About Centific
Centific is a frontier AI data foundry that curates diverse, high-quality data, using our purpose-built technology platforms to empower the Magnificent Seven and our enterprise clients with safe, scalable AI deployment. Our team includes more than 150 PhDs and data scientists, along with more than 4,000 AI practitioners and engineers. We harness the power of an integrated solution ecosystem—comprising industry-leading partnerships and 1.8 million vertical domain experts in more than 230 markets—to create contextual, multilingual, pre-trained datasets; fine-tuned, industry-specific LLMs; and RAG pipelines supported by vector databases. Our zero-distance innovation™ solutions for GenAI can reduce GenAI costs by up to 80% and bring solutions to market 50% faster.
Our mission is to bridge the gap between AI creators and industry leaders by bringing best practices in GenAI to unicorn innovators and enterprise customers. Your Authentic Self at Centific

Title: Senior Machine Learning Engineer – Financial Applications
Full Job Description:
Investbanq is an AI-powered wealth operating system designed for family offices, asset managers, and banks. Our mission is to empower traditional financial institutions to seamlessly transform into AI-driven WealthTech leaders, enabling them to capitalize on the growing wealth transfer to affluent millennials and other digital natives across Emerging Asia and MENA.
The Role
We are looking for a technically skilled and entrepreneurial Senior Machine Learning Engineer to drive the development of advanced AI and machine learning solutions for financial applications. You will take charge of building, deploying, and maintaining innovative models for portfolio optimization, forecasting, and risk management. In this role, you will manage the entire product development lifecycle—from writing extensive code and designing robust algorithms to ensuring that project milestones and stakeholder expectations are met.
Key responsibilities
End-to-end product development
Research, design, code, test, and deploy machine learning models and services tailored for financial applications such as portfolio construction and market forecasting.
Take complete ownership of projects from concept through production, ensuring high-quality, scalable, and maintainable solutions.
Technical innovation & problem solving
Leverage state-of-the-art techniques to solve complex challenges in financial analytics.
Continuously research and implement new methodologies to enhance model accuracy and efficiency.
Team engagement
Collaborate with internal stakeholders to gather requirements, manage expectations, and translate business needs into technical solutions.
Communicate complex technical concepts clearly to non-technical audiences and ensure alignment with business objectives.
Data governance & compliance
Ensure that all solutions adhere to stringent data security, governance, and regulatory standards prevalent in the financial sector.
Implement rigorous testing and monitoring frameworks to maintain system integrity and performance.
Ideal Profile
You possess a strong educational foundation with a Bachelor's, Master's, or Ph.D. in Computer Science, Data Science, Machine Learning, or a closely related discipline, coupled with 5+ years of compelling hands-on experience in the
full lifecycle of ML/AI solutions
– from initial design and robust implementation to successful deployment in production.
You are an expert programmer fluent in
Python
, consistently writing clean and well-tested code, and you command proficiency across key ML frameworks including
PyTorch, TensorFlow,
and
scikit-learn.
You navigate the world of
natural language processing (NLP)
with ease, expertly wielding transformer-based libraries like
Hugging Face Transformers
, employing
spaCy
or
NLTK
for sophisticated text preprocessing, and adeptly managing embedding storage and retrieval through vector databases such as
Pinecone, Weaviate,
or
Milvus
.

or

to construct innovative conversational or retrieval-augmented pipelines.
You exhibit a robust understanding of data architectures and are familiar with big-data technologies like
Spark
and
Kafka
, complemented by experience deploying solutions on major cloud platforms like
AWS, GCP,
or
Azure
.
You bring a foundational awareness of
time-series forecasting
or
risk-analysis workflows,
with any
financial background
being a plus, and you understand the importance of software engineering best practices, including
CI/CD, automated testing,
and
containerization with Docker/Kubernetes
.

NLP/LLM applications,
such as
chatbots, document Q&A systems,
or
summarization tools
, and familiarity with
MLOps frameworks
like
MLflow, Airflow,
or
Kubeflow
would be advantageous.

regulated
or
security-sensitive environments
, showcasing your ability to navigate complex compliance requirements.

Exciting opportunity to build cutting-edge AI solutions in a high-growth WealthTech startup
Be part of a collaborative and inclusive corporate culture that values innovation and initiative

As an ERP Project Manager, you will plan, organize, manage, and deliver client projects. You will be responsible for coordinating and monitoring project activities and client engagements from inception to installation, preparing project deliverables, and maintaining control of project schedules, resources, budgets, and scope. We are seeking applicants with strong organizational, project management, and time management skills, a customer-centric and results-oriented mindset, and the ability to work independently.
What you will be doing:
Coordinate and monitor activities of projects and client engagements, from inception to installation.
Prepare project deliverables (Project Plan, Project Change Requests, and Project Lists) and use these deliverables to execute all project activities.
Maintain overall control of project schedule, resources, budget, and scope, ensuring project plans and work products are based on approved and agreed-upon requirements.
Certify that sufficient resources and funding are available for executing project activities.
Conduct weekly customer status calls and respond to client requests/questions in a timely manner, escalating issues and recommending solutions.
Interact with members of cross-functional teams, responsible for ad hoc projects and medium-sized projects.
What you will likely bring:
5+ years of applicable experience and demonstrated success/knowledge.
Strong organizational, project management, and time management skills.
Customer-centric, results-oriented, self-starter, and able to work independently.
Strong listening, verbal, and written communication skills, including virtual presentations.
Ability to manage expectations and establish solid working relationships through the management level.
Regularly works at client sites; travel to other countries may be required up to 35% of the time.
What could set you apart:
5+ years of project management and industry experience preferred.
Bachelor’s degree preferred (or equivalent experience).
PMP or CAPM Certification preferred.
ERP implementation experience preferred.

Title: Senior IT Infrastructure Engineer
Full Job Description:
Boon Group (Malaysia) Sdn Bhd is a consulting company providing end-to-end data analytics, data integration and process automation solutions.
Our professional consulting and support team has extensive background in business analytics and ERP systems across different industries.
We are seeking an experienced and motivated IT Infrastructure Engineer to join our rapidly growing team.
Key Responsibilities:
Manage incoming support tickets through
JIRA
, ensuring timely resolution and high customer satisfaction.
Linux
is a must.
Deliver exceptional customer service and comprehensive IT support for clients, in-office and remote employees.
Troubleshoot and resolve hardware (desktops, laptops, network devices), software, and connectivity issues using in-person and remote assistance tools.
Oversee IT equipment inventory, ensuring accurate asset logging, procurement, and decommissioning of hardware.
Deploy and manage containerised applications using
Kubernetes
and
Docker
to support scalable and efficient IT infrastructure.
Conduct regular audits and maintain an up-to-date inventory system.
Monitor, manage, and maintain on-premise and cloud infrastructure, including servers, networks, and storage systems.
Perform routine IT operations, including patch management, data backups, and disaster recovery procedures.
Manage and troubleshoot network devices such as routers, switches, and firewalls to ensure connectivity and network security.
Implement network upgrades and monitor performance across all company locations.
Set up and maintain telecommunications systems (VoIP, video conferencing) and audio-visual equipment for meetings.
Maintain accurate documentation for IT systems, configurations, and processes.
Provide regular reports on IT infrastructure performance and track incidents for analysis and future improvements.
Create and maintain detailed troubleshooting guides and knowledge base articles.
Identify process improvement opportunities and suggest enhancements to optimize support operations.

Qualifications:
Bachelor's degree in Computer Science, Information Technology, Engineering, or a related field.
Over
7 years of experience
in hands-on IT infrastructure support or a similar position.
Ability to work on-call and address urgent issues outside of standard business hours as needed.
Strong English communication skills, both verbal and written.
Proficiency in operating systems such as Linux, Windows, and Mac, with expertise in security hardening and patch management.
Experience managing cloud infrastructure, including AWS (e.g., EC2, storage, VPC) and Azure, as well as on-premise virtualized servers.
Solid understanding of networking principles (e.g., OSI model, TCP/IP) and hands-on experience with network devices and security measures (e.g., firewalls, system hardening).
Proven experience in IT asset management and inventory control.
Strong troubleshooting, analytical, and problem-solving abilities.
Ability to provide effective on-site and remote support, with clear communication to non-technical users.
Familiarity with Jira or similar ticketing systems, including the creation and assignment of tasks for team members.
Competence in conveying technical details to non-technical individuals.
Skill in utilizing search engines and AI tools to research and resolve technical issues.
Desirable:
Experience with following software and tools -
Proxmox, NinjaOne RMM, Synology, Rancher, Portainer,
and
Gitlab
.

Boon Group does not accept unsolicited CV's from recruitment agents and is only considering direct applications.
